a:7:{s:12:"wpforms-lite";a:28:{s:4:"name";s:74:"Contact Form by WPForms &#8211; Drag &amp; Drop Form Builder for WordPress";s:4:"slug";s:12:"wpforms-lite";s:7:"version";s:7:"1.7.1.2";s:6:"author";s:41:"<a href="https://wpforms.com">WPForms</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:41:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/jaredatch/";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.9";s:6:"tested";s:5:"5.8.2";s:12:"requires_php";s:3:"5.5";s:6:"rating";i:98;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:10192;i:4;i:232;i:3;i:60;i:2;i:46;i:1;i:228;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:10758;s:15:"support_threads";i:82;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:72;s:10:"downloaded";i:90315350;s:12:"last_updated";s:22:"2021-11-18 12:05pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2016-03-14";s:8:"homepage";s:19:"https://wpforms.com";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:27246:"<h4>WordPress Contact Form Builder Plugin</h4>
<p>We believe that you shouldn&#8217;t have to hire a developer to create a WordPress contact form. That&#8217;s why we built <a href="https://wpforms.com/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" title="WPForms" rel="friend nofollow ugc">WPForms</a>, a drag &amp; drop WordPress form builder that&#8217;s EASY and POWERFUL.</p>
<p>WPForms allows you to create beautiful contact forms, feedback form, subscription forms, payment forms, and other types of forms for your site in minutes, not hours!</p>
<p>At WPForms, user experience is our #1 priority. Our pre-built form templates and workflows make WPForms the most beginner friendly contact form plugin in the market.</p>
<p>The WPForms Challenge guides you through creating your first form in under 5 minutes. We walk you through using the form builder all the way to adding a form to a page on your site! WPForms includes integrations for popular page builders like the WordPress Block Editor (Gutenberg), Classic Editor, Elementor, and Divi making the whole process seamless.</p>
<p>WPForms is a 100% mobile responsive contact form solution, so your contact forms will always look great on all devices (mobile, tablet, laptop, and desktop).</p>
<p>WPForms&#8217; contact forms are also highly optimized for web and server performance because we understand the importance of speed when it comes to SEO, marketing, and conversion. We can honestly say that WPForms is one of the fastest WordPress contact form builder plugins in the world.</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>WPForms Pro</strong><br />
  This plugin is the lite version of the WPForms Pro plugin that comes with all the contact form features you will ever need including email subscription forms, multi-page contact forms, file uploads, conditional logic, payment integrations, form templates, and tons more. <a href="https://wpforms.com/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" title="WPForms" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Click here to purchase the best premium WordPress contact form plugin now!</a></p>
</blockquote>
<p>We took the pain out of creating contact forms and made it easy. Here&#8217;s why smart business owners, designers, and developers love WPForms, and you will too!</p>
<p><span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe loading="lazy" class="youtube-player" width="640" height="360" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/eiQ3viAGung?version=3&#038;rel=0&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;fs=1&#038;hl=en-US&#038;autohide=2&#038;wmode=transparent" allowfullscreen="true" style="border:0;" sandbox="allow-scripts allow-same-origin allow-popups allow-presentation"></iframe></span></p>
<h4>Drag &amp; Drop Contact Form Builder</h4>
<p>We were tired of the bloated and buggy contact form builder plugins. That&#8217;s why we built WPForms to adapt to your workflow and allow you to create custom contact forms in minutes. By using our easy to use <a href="https://wpforms.com/features/drag-drop-online-form-builder/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">drag and drop online form builder</a>, you can easily add custom form fields, rearrange them, and basically create a complete contact form in 5 minutes or less.</p>
<p>But don&#8217;t just take our word. See what one of the WordPress experts are saying:</p>
<blockquote>
<p>WPForms is by far the <strong>easiest form plugin to use</strong>. My clients love WPForms and it&#8217;s one of the few plugins they can use without any training. As a developer I appreciate how fast, modern, clean and extensible it is.<br />
  Bill Erickson &#8211; Expert WordPress Consultant</p>
</blockquote>
<h4>Pre-built Form Templates</h4>
<p>Building contact forms in WordPress can be time consuming. Why?</p>
<p>Because every other WordPress contact form builder plugin requires you to build your contact form from scratch. The truth is it&#8217;s often not necessary to create a contact form completely from scratch unless you really want to.</p>
<p>Whether you&#8217;re looking to create a simple contact form, marketing form, request a quote form, donation form, payment order form, registration form, or a subscription form, we have a form template for you inside our contact form builder.</p>
<p>WPForms comes with <a href="https://wpforms.com/features/form-templates/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">pre-built form templates</a> to help you save time. You can add, remove, or re-arrange fields as necessary.</p>
<p>See <a href="https://wpforms.com/templates/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">300+ Pre-Made WPForms Form Template Demo</a></p>
<h4>Mobile Ready, SEO Friendly and Optimized for Speed</h4>
<p>WPForms&#8217; contact forms are 100% responsive and mobile-friendly by default. We also optimized every query on the front-end and the back-end to ensure maximum speed &#8211; Yes, WPForms is one of the fastest WordPress contact form plugin.</p>
<p>You can embed your contact form on any page with optimized title and description. With the speed and proper formatting, WPForms is also one of the most SEO friendly contact form plugin.</p>
<h4>All the Fields &amp; Features that You Need to Succeed</h4>
<p>From star ratings to file uploads to multi-page contact forms with progress bar, we have all the fields you need.</p>
<p>You can easily integrate your contact forms with an email marketing service or collect payments for bookings and orders. WPForms allows you to do it all.</p>
<p>The best part is, you can do it all without hiring a developer.</p>
<p>See what one business owner has to say about WPForms&#8217; contact form:</p>
<blockquote>
<p>As a business owner, time is my most valuable asset. WPForms allow me to create smart contact forms with just a few clicks. With their pre-built form templates and the drag &amp; drop builder, I can create a new form that works in less than 2 minutes without writing a single line of code. Well worth the investment.<br />
  David Henzel &#8211; Co-founder of MaxCDN</p>
</blockquote>
<h4>Surveys &amp; Polls</h4>
<p>Along with contact form, you can also use WPForms to create surveys and polls.</p>
<p>Our <a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/surveys-and-polls-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">WordPress Survey plugin addon</a> comes with smart survey fields including likert scale, star ratings, multiple choice, Net Promoter Score (NPS), and more, so you can create custom survey forms like Survey Monkey (without the high costs).</p>
<p>WPForms offer the best-in class survey reporting. You can use our interactive reports to customize the graphs, export them for your presentations, and even display the aggregate results to your users.</p>
<p>The best part about WPForms survey reports is that it can retroactively work on any old contact form or feedback survey contact form created with WPForms.</p>
<p>Thousands of businesses love WPForms surveys for creating employee feedback form, customer feedback form, online petition form, and more.</p>
<p>You can also use the surveys &amp; polls addon to easily create a poll on your site. To save you time when creating a user poll, we have added a built-in poll forms template. Our poll feature offers real-time reports, so you can share poll results with the user immediately after they submit their vote.</p>
<p>Just like the contact form, you can embed your surveys and polls inside any post, page, or widget area in WordPress.</p>
<h4>Membership and Default WordPress Forms</h4>
<p>Aside from building simple contact forms which every WordPress site needs, WPForms also helps you create better default WordPress forms.</p>
<p>For example, you can use WPForms to create custom WordPress login forms and custom WordPress user registration forms which are great for <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/wp-tutorials/ultimate-guide-to-creating-a-wordpress-membership-site/" rel="nofollow ugc">membership sites</a>.</p>
<p>For membership sites, you can also use WPForms to create a password-protected contact form or even a members only contact form which is restricted to logged-in users only.</p>
<p>Even if you&#8217;re not using a WordPress membership plugin, you can use WPForms to create membership registration forms, online RSVP forms, and other address book contact forms.</p>
<p>Bloggers and publishers can use our WordPress post submission forms to accept guest posts, testimonials contact form to collect testimonials, and partnership agreement forms to grow their business.</p>
<h4>Payment Form, Donation Form, Booking Form, and More</h4>
<p>While WPForms started out as a contact form plugin, it has evolved into a powerful custom forms solution that you can use to create a payment form, donation form, registration form, online booking form, mobile form, and basically any type of custom form you need.</p>
<p>WPForms integrates with both PayPal, Stripe, Square, and Authorize.Net so you can easily create a credit card payment form to accept payments on your website. If you&#8217;re using SSL, then you can use our Stripe, Square, or Authorize.Net Payment forms to accept credit card payments directly on your website. Alternatively you can use our PayPal payment form to make a donation form and accept payments online.</p>
<p>Aside from simple order forms, business owners also use WPForms to create custom product purchase forms, t-shirt order forms, online booking forms, and more.</p>
<p>We understand that sometimes you may need to create a contact form that require a signature. WPForms comes with a signature field to collect user signature on your WordPress forms or even create custom signature forms.</p>
<p>You can do all of this while still using the same easy-to-use contact form builder that&#8217;s loved by over 5 million users.</p>
<blockquote>
<p>I am so impressed with this plugin. I decided to give it a shot over some of the other form plugins, and I am so glad I did. It works well, is so easy to use and customize. The support is amazing on top of it all. I got the pro version because I was so pleased. Highly recommend.<br />
  Micky73 &#8211; WordPress user</p>
</blockquote>
<h4>Forms that are Optimized for Conversion and Results</h4>
<p>With our Form Pages addon, you can create distraction-free custom form landing pages like Google Forms and Wufoo right inside WordPress, so you can increase conversions without the high costs (<a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/form-pages-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">See Form Pages Demo</a>).</p>
<p>To improve form completion rate, we created Conversational Forms&reg; which helps you make your generic feedback form and other custom contact forms feel more human by adding an interactive form layout. Our conversational forms are similar to Typeform without the high subscription costs (<a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/conversational-forms-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">See Conversational Forms Demo</a>).</p>
<p>WPForms also has other conversion optimization features such as our smart form logic that lets you create dynamic contact forms where fields change based on user&#8217;s answer, multi-page contact forms with progress bar, and other advanced contact forms.</p>
<p>WPForms form analytics integration with MonsterInsights allow you to easily track your lead capture forms, newsletter signup forms, request a quote contact form, and other important forms on your site.</p>
<h4>Easy to Customize and Extend</h4>
<p>You can easily customize your contact forms with our section dividers, HTML blocks, and custom CSS.</p>
<p>If you&#8217;re using Elementor or Divi page builders our native integrations let you quickly customize the style of your forms. Embedding forms in Elementor and Divi has never been easier.</p>
<p>We also knew that our developer friends may want to extend simple contact forms further. That&#8217;s why WPForms come with tons of hooks and filters to create custom functionality.</p>
<p>Since contact forms are essential for marketing, WPForms is a must have plugin for every website!</p>
<h4>Full WPForms Feature List</h4>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/features/drag-drop-online-form-builder/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Online Form Builder</a> &#8211; Our powerful drag &amp; drop contact form builder allows you to easily create WordPress contact forms and other online forms in just a few minutes without writing any code.</li>
<li>100% Responsive &#8211; Mobile Friendly contact forms.</li>
<li>GDPR Friendly &#8211; Make your contact form GDPR compatible with just a few clicks.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/features/form-templates/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Form Templates</a> &#8211; Use our pre-built form templates to save time. Never start from scratch again (see all <a href="https://wpforms.com/templates/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">form templates demos</a>).</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/features/spam-protection/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Spam Protection</a> &#8211; WPForms provides smart anti-spam protection out-of-the-box, plus direct integrations with hCaptcha and Google reCAPTCHA.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/features/instant-notifications/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Instant Form Notification</a> &#8211; Quickly respond to incoming inquiries with our instant contact form notification system.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/features/form-confirmation/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Smart Form Confirmation</a> &#8211; Show a custom success message, or redirect users to a custom thank you page.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/features/file-uploads/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">File Uploads</a> &#8211; Collect files and media through your contact forms with File Uploads.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/features/multi-page-forms/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Multi-Page Forms</a> &#8211; Split long forms into multiple pages with progress bar to improve user experience.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/features/conditional-logic/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Smart Conditional Logic</a> &#8211; Show or hide fields and contact form sections based on user behavior.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/signature-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Signature Forms</a> &#8211; Create signature forms or add the signature field to your contact form, application form, booking form, etc.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/user-registration-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">User Registration Forms</a> &#8211; Create custom user registration form and custom login form in WordPress.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/post-submissions-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Post Submissions</a> &#8211; Collect user-submitted content in WordPress with our front-end post submission form. Great for guest posts, testimonials, business directory, listings, etc.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/geolocation-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Geolocation</a> &#8211; Display location information about your users.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/custom-catpcha-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Custom Captchas</a> &#8211; Create custom captchas for your contact form.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/surveys-and-polls-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Surveys and Polls</a> &#8211; Easily create surveys forms and analyze the data with interactive reports.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/form-abandonment-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Form Abandonment</a> &#8211; Unlock more leads and grow your business with partial-form submission.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/form-locker-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Form Locker</a> &#8211; Manage form permissions and add access control rules including password-protected forms, members only forms, limit contact form entry per person, close form after specific date / time, etc.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/offline-forms-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Offline Forms</a> &#8211; Let your visitors save their entered data offline and submit when their internet connection is restored.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/form-pages-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Form Landing Pages</a> &#8211; Create &#8220;distraction-free&#8221; form landing pages to boost conversions. Great Google Forms and Wufoo alternative.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/conversational-forms-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Conversational Forms</a> &#8211; Interactive form layout that makes your form feels more human and boost overall completion rate. Great for surveys and registration forms. Perfect Typeform alternative for WordPress without the high costs.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/webhooks-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Webhooks</a> &#8211; Send form entry data to secondary tools and external services. No code required, and no need for a third party connector.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/user-journey-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">User Journey Reporting</a> &#8211; Discover the steps your visitors take before they submit your forms. Right in the WordPress dashboard, you can easily see the content thatâ€™s driving the most valuable form conversions.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/paypal-standard-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">PayPal Payment Forms</a> &#8211; Create PayPal forms to easily collect payments, donations, and online orders.</li>

<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/square-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Square Forms</a> &#8211; Accept payments faster, from anywhere with Square&#8217;s secure payment processing with the Square addon.</li>

<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/mailchimp-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Mailchimp Forms</a> &#8211; Create Mailchimp newsletter signup forms in WordPress and connect with your contact form to grow your email list.</li>

<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/campaign-monitor-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Campaign Monitor Forms</a> &#8211; Create Campaign Monitor newsletter signup forms in WordPress and connect with your contact form to grow your email list.</li>

<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/drip-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Drip Forms</a> &#8211; Create Drip newsletter signup forms in WordPress and connect with your contact form to grow your email list.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/activecampaign-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">ActiveCampaign Forms</a> &#8211; Add contacts to your ActiveCampaign account, record events, add notes to contacts, and more.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/sendinblue-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Sendinblue Forms</a> &#8211; Create Sendinblue forms to automate your marketing and engage your subscribers.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/salesforce-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Salesforce Forms</a> &#8211; Easily send your WordPress form contacts and leads to your Salesforce CRM account.</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/zapier-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Zapier Addon</a> &#8211; Connect your WordPress forms with over 1000+ apps. Route your contact form data to your favorite CRM, email marketing service, etc.</li>
</ul>
<p>After reading this feature list, you can probably imagine why WPForms is the best WordPress contact form plugin in the market.</p>

</ul>

<h3>Notes</h3>
<p>WPForms is absolutely, positively the most <a href="https://wpforms.com/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" title="Best WordPress contact form plugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">beginner friendly WordPress contact form plugin</a> on the market. It is both easy and powerful.</p>
<p>We took the pain out of creating online forms and made it easy. Check out all <a href="https://wpforms.com/features/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">WPForms features</a>.</p>
<p>Also, I&#8217;m the founder of <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/" rel="friend nofollow ugc">WPBeginner</a>, the largest WordPress resource site for beginners. It was a huge priority for me to make a WordPress contact form plugin that beginners can use without any training.</p>
<p>I feel that we have done that here. I hope you enjoy using WPForms.</p>
<p>Thank you</p>
<p>Syed Balkhi</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:739:"<ol>
<li>Install WPForms Lite either via the WordPress.org plugin repository or by uploading the files to your server. (See instructions on <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/beginners-guide/step-by-step-guide-to-install-a-wordpress-plugin-for-beginners/" rel="friend nofollow ugc">how to install a WordPress plugin</a>)</li>
<li>Activate WPForms Lite.</li>
<li>Navigate to the WPForms tab at the bottom of your admin menu and click the &#8220;Add New&#8221; button to begin creating your new WordPress contact form.</li>
<li>Want more features? <a href="https://wpforms.com/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" title="WPForms" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Purchase the full version of WPForms</a>!</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:8780:"
<dt id='who%20should%20use%20wpforms%3F'>
Who should use WPForms?
</h4>
<p>
<p>WPForms is perfect for business owners, bloggers, designers, developers, photographers, and basically everyone else. If you want to create a custom WordPress form, then you need to use the WPForms drag &amp; drop form builder.</p>
</p>
<dt id='do%20i%20need%20to%20have%20coding%20skills%20to%20use%20wpforms%3F'>
Do I need to have coding skills to use WPForms?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Absolutely not. You can create and manage forms without any coding knowledge (100% drag &amp; drop form builder). WPForms is the most beginner friendly contact form plugin in the market.</p>
</p>
<dt id='what%20type%20of%20wordpress%20forms%20can%20i%20build%20with%20wpforms%3F'>
What type of WordPress forms can I build with WPForms?
</h4>
<p>
<p>WPForms drag &amp; drop form builder combined with our addons is the most powerful WordPress contact form plugin in the market. Here are some types of WordPress forms you can create:</p>
<ul>
<li>Simple Contact Forms</li>
<li>Job Application Contact Form</li>
<li>Feedback Survey Contact Form</li>
<li>Make a Suggestion Contact Form</li>
<li>Change Request Forms</li>
<li>Online Booking Forms</li>
<li>Event Booking Form</li>
<li>Video Release Forms</li>
<li>PTO Request Contact Form</li>
<li>Maintenance Request Contact Form</li>
<li>Scholarship Application Forms</li>
<li>File Download Forms</li>
<li>Employment Verification Forms</li>
<li>Make a Referral Contact Form</li>
<li>Volunteer Registration Contact Form</li>
<li>Offline Contact Form</li>
</ul>
<p>To see a full list, visit our <a href="https://wpforms.com/templates/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Form Template Gallery</a> which has over 150+ pre-made contact form templates.</p>
</p>
<dt id='which%20form%20fields%20does%20wpforms%20offer%3F'>
Which Form Fields Does WPForms offer?
</h4>
<p>
<p>We made WPForms form builder to be both easy and powerful.</p>
<p>Here are the contact form fields that comes with WPForms Form Builder (also known as Standard Fields):</p>
<ul>
<li>Text Field</li>
<li>Paragraph Text (Textarea)</li>
<li>Dropdown Field</li>
<li>Multiple Choice (Radio Buttons)</li>
<li>Checkboxes</li>
<li>Numbers Field</li>
<li>Name Field</li>
<li>Email Address Field</li>
<li>Number Slider Field</li>
</ul>
<p>Here is a list of our advanced contact form builder fields (Fancy Fields):</p>
<ul>
<li>Website / URL Field</li>
<li>Address Field</li>
<li>Password Field</li>
<li>Smart Phone Field with international format verification</li>
<li>Date / Time Field</li>
<li>Hidden Field</li>
<li>HTML Field &#8211; add Custom HTML inside your form</li>
<li>File Upload &#8211; Great for File Upload Form</li>
<li>Page Break Field &#8211; Great for Multi Page Contact Form with Progress Bar</li>
<li>Section Divider &#8211; Great for Long Contact Forms</li>
<li>Entry Preview &#8211; Allow your form users to preview their form entries before they&#8217;ve submitted them</li>
<li>Rich Text &#8211; Add a WYSIWYG field, perfect for guest blog post forms</li>
<li>Signature Field &#8211; Great for Contracts and Booking Forms</li>
<li>Star Rating &#8211; Great for Survey Forms and Polls</li>
<li>Likert Scale &#8211; Great for Survey Forms</li>
<li>Net Promoter Score (NPS Field) &#8211; Great for Survey Forms</li>
<li>Questions CAPTCHA &#8211; Great for Preventing Contact Form Spam</li>
<li>Math CAPTCHA &#8211; Great for Preventing Contact Form Spam</li>
<li>Google ReCAPTCHA &#8211; Great for Preventing Contact Form Spam</li>
<li>hCAPTCHA &#8211; Great for Preventing Contact Form Spam</li>
</ul>
<p>Here is a list of our Payment Fields that will help you create a order form, donation form, booking form, and other payment forms:</p>
<ul>
<li>Single Item</li>
<li>Multiple Items</li>
<li>Checkbox Items</li>
<li>Dropdown Items</li>
<li>Total (Calculation Field)</li>
<li>Credit Card (Stripe, Square, and Authorize.Net)</li>
<li>PayPal</li>
</ul>
</p>
<dt id='can%20i%20integrate%20wpforms%20with%20my%20crm%20or%20email%20marketing%20service%3F'>
Can I integrate WPForms with my CRM or Email Marketing Service?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, WPForms offers seamless integration with over 1,000+ popular <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/showcase/best-email-marketing-services/" rel="nofollow ugc">email marketing</a> and <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/showcase/best-crm-software-for-small-businesses-compared/" rel="nofollow ugc">CRM software</a>.</p>
<p>You can easily send data from your contact form and other WordPress forms to your favorite CRM, email newsletter, and other marketing platforms.</p>
<p>Here is a list of our popular marketing integrations:</p>
<ul>
<li>Mailchimp</li>
<li>Constant Contact</li>
<li>AWeber</li>
<li>Drip</li>
<li>Campaign Monitor</li>
<li>GetResponse</li>
<li>ActiveCampaign</li>
<li>Zapier</li>
<li>Salesforce CRM</li>
<li>Sendinblue</li>
</ul>
<p>Using our Zapier integration, you can easily connect WPForms with over 1000+ marketing apps including:</p>
<ul>
<li>PipeDrive CRM</li>
<li>HubSpot Email Marketing</li>
<li>HubSpot CRM</li>
<li>Google Sheets</li>
<li>Active Campaign</li>
<li>Zoho CRM</li>
<li>Zoho Mail</li>
<li>Zoho Invoice</li>
<li>Agile CRM</li>
<li>Slack</li>
<li>Trello</li>
<li>Infusionsoft by Keap</li>
<li>Microsoft Excel</li>
<li>Dropbox</li>
<li>HelpScout</li>
<li>Zendesk</li>
<li>Freshbooks</li>
<li>Freshsales</li>
<li>Intercom</li>
<li>Click Funnels</li>
<li>Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM</li>
<li>Capsule CRM</li>
<li>Insightly CRM</li>
<li>Printfection</li>
<li>Acuity Scheduling</li>
<li>Quickbooks Online</li>
</ul>
<p>See all <a href="https://zapier.com/apps/wpforms/integrations" rel="nofollow ugc">WPForms Zapier Integrations</a>.</p>
<p>Note: WPForms was voted Zapier&#8217;s 8th fastest growing app in the world.</p>
</p>
<dt id='can%20i%20create%20a%20payment%20form%20with%20wpforms'>
Can I create a Payment Form with WPForms
</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, WPForms is not your average contact form plugin. You can use it to create any type of form including payment forms.</p>
<p>We make it easy for you to accept payments using Stripe, Authorize.Net, and PayPal.</p>
<p>Both our Stripe and Authorize.Net integrations helps you easily accept credit card payments online.</p>
<p>Our PayPal integration allows you to accept PayPal payments online.</p>
</p>
<dt id='can%20i%20import%20%2F%20export%20forms%20with%20wpforms%3F'>
Can I Import / Export Forms with WPForms?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, WPForms makes it easy to import / export your contact forms and other WordPress forms created with WPForms form builder. This is incredibly useful for developers and agencies who are building websites for clients.</p>
<p>You can also create custom form templates that you can use on client websites. For more see our documentation.</p>
<p>Aside from that, WPForms also allows you to import forms from other WordPress Contact Form plugins such as Contact Form 7, Ninja Forms, and Pirate Forms.</p>
<p>If you&#8217;re not happy with your WordPress contact form plugin, then definitely give WPForms a try!</p>
</p>
<dt id='i%27d%20like%20access%20to%20all%20features.%20how%20can%20i%20get%20them%3F'>
I&#8217;d like access to all features. How can I get them?
</h4>
<p>
<p>You can get access to more features, addons and support by <a href="https://wpforms.com/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" title="Click here to learn more about WPForms!" rel="friend nofollow ugc">upgrading to our Pro version</a>. Purchasing a Pro license gets you access to the full version of WPForms, automatic updates, priority support, and all WPForms Addons!</p>
</p>
<dt id='is%20wpforms%20translation%20ready%3F'>
Is WPForms translation ready?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, WPForms has full translation and localization support via the wpforms textdomain. All .mo and .po translation files should go into the languages folder in the base of the plugin. The same is true for every WPForms Addon as well.</p>
</p>
<dt id='does%20wpforms%20include%20spam%20protection%3F'>
Does WPForms include spam protection?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, WPForms includes spam protection which is enabled on all forms by default in the form settings.</p>
<p>Additionally, Google reCAPTCHA is also supported and can be setup at WPForms &gt; Settings &gt; reCAPTCHA.</p>
<p>WPForms is fully compatible with all versions of Google reCAPTCHA:</p>
<ul>
<li>Checkbox reCAPTCHA v2</li>
<li>Invisible reCAPTCHA v2</li>
<li>reCAPTCHA v3</li>
</ul>
<p>Lastly, <a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/custom-catpcha-addon/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteplugin" rel="friend nofollow ugc">Custom Captchas</a> are available which allow you to create math or question based captchas for your contact forms.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:21408:"<h4>1.7.1.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Edge case when form tokens (anti-spam protection) failed verification at certain time of a new day.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.7.1.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Changed: Improved translations by removing confusion if non-translatable placeholders are used.</li>
<li>Changed: Improved support for WordPress Core UI colors and admin themes in the admin bar menu.</li>
<li>Changed: Improved display of empty and hidden field labels in Form Builder preview.</li>
<li>Changed: Field helper notification in the Form Builder now can be dismissed.</li>
<li>Changed: Improved and standardized look of classic and modern Dropdown field across Form Builder, admin area, and frontend.</li>
<li>Fixed: Strip slashes from Paragraph Text field when the value is dynamically populated.</li>
<li>Fixed: SMTP settings page linked to Setup Wizard even when SMTP settings are already configured.</li>
<li>Fixed: Notifications count in the admin bar is misaligned.</li>
<li>Fixed: Field helper notification in the Form Builder overlaps and blocks Duplicate and Delete actions when hovered.</li>
<li>Fixed: Non-latin (Punycode) email addresses are not converted for display in email suggestion hints.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.7.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added: Uncanny Automator integration.</li>
<li>Changed: Updated jQuery Validation library to v1.9.3.</li>
<li>Fixed: Incorrect handling of language files downloads when the plugin is activated, or site language is changed.</li>
<li>Fixed: Alignment for admin notification counter.</li>
<li>Fixed: Javascript error in Elementor page builder.</li>
<li>Fixed: Embedded forms into global sidebar report about an error in the Divi page builder.</li>
<li>Fixed: Change settings were not applied for a Duplicated Modern Dropdown field.</li>
<li>Fixed: Form fields not displaying full width on mobile devices with Base form styling selected.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.6.9</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added: Keyboard Shortcuts informational popup in the Form Builder, triggered with <code>Ctrl + /</code> shortcut.</li>
<li>Added: Separate category for templates added by addons.</li>
<li>Added: Smart Tags support in Confirmation Messages.</li>
<li>Added: Punycode support for the Email field to allow using international domain names.</li>
<li>Added: Compatibility with PHP 8.</li>
<li>Changed: Display only WPForms related actions on the Tools &gt; Scheduled Actions page.</li>
<li>Changed: Enable AJAX form submission by default for new forms created using Blank template and addon templates.</li>
<li>Changed: Default state on the CAPTCHA Settings screen on new installs is now set to None.</li>
<li>Changed: Improved consistency of various modal popups in the Form Builder.</li>
<li>Changed: Speed up form preview in the Form Builder by limiting the number of choices displayed.</li>
<li>Changed: Updated ActionScheduler library to 3.2.1.</li>
<li>Fixed: Missing down arrow in the Dropdown field in the Twenty Twenty-One theme on a fresh install.</li>
<li>Fixed: Clicking on the Field Options tab in the Form Builder always opens options for the first field in the form.</li>
<li>Fixed: Form Setting panels can be broken by horizontally resizing textarea fields.</li>
<li>Fixed: Insert/edit link button not working in the Confirmation Message editor.</li>
<li>Fixed: Prevent editor styles from loading on various settings pages.</li>
<li>Fixed: Missing Conditional Logic class in the Lite version causing errors when using custom integration that extends the <code>WPForms_Provider</code> class.</li>
<li>Fixed: Console error in Chrome when re-ordering choices in the Dropdown, Checkboxes and Multiple Choice field settings.</li>
<li>Fixed: Unrelated admin notices are no longer displayed on the WPForms admin pages.</li>
<li>Fixed: Modern Dropdown field not initialized properly in the Divi Builder.</li>
<li>Fixed: Dropdown preview in the Form Builder not updated if the first option&#8217;s value is empty.</li>
<li>Fixed: Preserve reply-to in the Notifications settings when creating a form from a template.</li>
<li>Fixed: Minor button styling issue in WordPress 4.9.</li>
<li>Fixed: Avoid error by allowing objects implementing the <code>__invoke()</code> method as a hook callback.</li>
<li>Fixed: Various Dropdown field CSS issues in the Form Builder.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.6.8.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Changed: Allow using right-click to open a form preview in a new tab or window.</li>
<li>Fixed: Notifications disabled on the previous version were enabled after the 1.6.8 update.</li>
<li>Fixed: Block preview in new WordPress 5.8 Widgets Block Editor now aligned properly.</li>
<li>Fixed: Word wrapping issues in various places for non-English languages.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.6.8</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added: Form Builder visual modernization and improved user experience.</li>
<li>Added: Form Builder is now more optimized, loading and performing faster.</li>
<li>Added: More tooltips in various areas of the Form Builder to provide context for different options.</li>
<li>Added: A lot more Templates that you can use for one-click forms creation.</li>
<li>Added: Categorize Form Templates into different sections and improve search, allowing faster access and better user experience.</li>
<li>Added: New Preview button for all Templates, so you can check how your form will look like before applying the Template.</li>
<li>Changed: Dropped support for IE11 in the Form Builder (same as WordPress 5.8).</li>
<li>Changed: Introducing tabs instead of accordion for Field Options in the Form Builder: General, Advanced, Smart Logic.</li>
<li>Changed: Allow underscore symbol usage in Allowlist/Denylist in Email field.</li>
<li>Changed: Updated DOMPurify lib to 2.3.0.</li>
<li>Fixed: A lot of visual inconsistencies inside the Form Builder.</li>
<li>Fixed: TinyMCE editor in the default Confirmation has 2 tabs (Visual, Text), which previously had incorrect height.</li>
<li>Fixed: Firefox-specific issue that prevents fields from being drag-n-dropped inside the Preview area of the Form Builder.</li>
<li>Fixed: Form Builder performance issue with large number of choices added to option fields.</li>
<li>Fixed: Missing down arrow in Dropdown field in Twenty Twenty-One theme.</li>
<li>Fixed: Checkboxes and Multiple Choice input fields rendered incorrectly in Twenty Twenty-One theme.</li>
<li>Fixed: Breaking words when wrapping in Modern Dropdown field.</li>
<li>Fixed: Download all relevant translations when initiating an upgrade from Lite to Pro on the plugin Settings page.</li>
<li>Fixed: Preserve line breaks when pasting blocks of text into Paragraph field with word limit option enabled.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.6.7.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>Changed: Renamed a misspelled <code>wpforms_display_sumbit_spinner_src</code> filter to <code>wpforms_display_submit_spinner_src</code>, old name is now deprecated.</li>
<li>Fixed: Expired transients are not deleted automatically.</li>
<li>Fixed: Entries count race condition under high load in the plugin Lite version.</li>
<li>Fixed: Form Builder product education links.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.6.7.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Admin notice option flag reference.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.6.7.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Changed: Improved logic of pasting a text in the fields with word and character limits.</li>
<li>Changed: Updated DOMPurify lib to 2.2.9.</li>
<li>Changed: Some admin notices can be dismissed on a per-user basis.</li>
<li>Fixed: Smart Tags don&#8217;t parse dot and comma symbols well.</li>
<li>Fixed: In rare cases, WPForms functions calls are not handled correctly inside the third-party frontend AJAX calls.</li>
<li>Fixed: Incorrect <code>wpforms_smart_tag_process</code> filter deprecation notice.</li>
<li>Fixed: Compatibility with the Elementor 3.1.x, 3.2.x and 3.3.x.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.6.7</h4>
<ul>
<li>Changed: Email Summaries can now be tweaked via the hook to have multiple &#8220;To&#8221; recipients.</li>
<li>Changed: Email Summaries subject line is changed to reduce a chance of going into spam folder.</li>
<li>Changed: Rewrote inline captcha scripts in vanilla JS to improve its compatibility with a third-party code.</li>
<li>Changed: Replaced jQuery.isFunction() (deprecated as of jQuery 3.3) usages with a recommended counterpart.</li>
<li>Changed: Refine smart tags system to improve extensibility.</li>
<li>Changed: Each addon title is linked to a related documentation on the Addons page.</li>
<li>Changed: Externally disabled fields are displayed inside the Form Builder as dismissible notices.</li>
<li>Changed: Updated DOMPurify lib to 2.2.8.</li>
<li>Fixed: Inconsistent Form Builder JS events loading order in jQuery 3+ across different browsers.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.6.6</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added: WordPress 5.7 new color scheme compatibility.</li>
<li>Changed: Allow using 0/false values in choices label for Checkboxes, Multiple Choice, Dropdown fields.</li>
<li>Changed: Better AJAX form submit error messages handling for the Email field.</li>
<li>Changed: Refactored Tools page with all of its subpages for easier long-term support.</li>
<li>Changed: Updated the WPForms &gt; About Us page.</li>
<li>Changed: Updated DOMPurify lib to 2.2.7.</li>
<li>Changed: Replaced jQuery.ready() function usage with a recommended way since jQuery 3.0.</li>
<li>Fixed: HTML layout is broken on the Analytics page for some site languages.</li>
<li>Fixed: Incorrect permission checks for different places in the dashboard and the Form Builder.</li>
<li>Fixed: RTL support for Name, Email fields.</li>
<li>Fixed: Speed up the Form Builder rendering by loading certain scripts only when the Embed functionality is triggered.</li>
<li>Fixed: The <code>iframe</code> HTML element was rendered incorrectly in the Twenty Twenty theme.</li>
<li>Fixed: The Checkboxes and Multiple Choice fields CSS issues in Twenty Twenty-One theme.</li>
<li>Fixed: WPForms Challenge was drunk in the Firefox browser.</li>
<li>Fixed: reCAPTCHA doesn&#8217;t render in a popup when the same form exists in another place.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.6.5</h4>
<ul>
<li>Changed: Updated DOMPurify lib to 2.2.6.</li>
<li>Changed: Reload the Form Builder after Save and Embed option usage, and going back using the browser Back button.</li>
<li>Changed: Disable From Name and From Email fields in Form Builder &gt; Notifications when the WP Mail SMTP plugin forces those values.</li>
<li>Fixed: The Gutenberg block JavaScript issue in WordPress 5.0-5.1.1 versions.</li>
<li>Fixed: The Gutenberg block CSS issues in Twenty Twenty-One theme.</li>
<li>Fixed: AMP incompatible script for Lite version.</li>
<li>Fixed: Logs records on WPForms &gt; Tools &gt; Logs may not be clickable under certain circumstances, preventing previewing the logged information.</li>
<li>Fixed: Email Summaries ignoring timezone offset while generating reports.</li>
<li>Fixed: Email Suggestion feature when using two or more forms on a page.</li>
<li>Fixed: Missing on-hover tooltips&#8217; after cloning/duplicating elements in the Form Builder.</li>
<li>Fixed: Minor styling issues on the WPForms &gt; Tools &gt; Logs page.</li>
<li>Fixed: Issues while importing forms saved in UTF-8 with BOM.</li>
<li>Fixed: Improve performance of the WPForms Challenge.</li>
<li>Fixed: WPForms module icon compatibility with the latest Elementor version.</li>
<li>Fixed: Incorrect CPT and taxonomy terms alphabetical sorting of the Dynamic Choice option values for fields that support this Advanced Option.</li>
<li>Fixed: Compatibility with WordPress 4.9 on the WPForms &gt; Analytics/SMTP pages.</li>
<li>Fixed: AJAX form submissions on some server configuration.</li>
<li>Fixed: Improve Admin Menu Bar support since WordPress 5.2.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.6.4.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added: Frontend form warning indicating missing WPForms JS (visible to admin only).</li>
<li>Changed: Help hCaptcha process all requests in a more efficient way, so bot detection will work better.</li>
<li>Fixed: Improve pagination on Tools &gt; Logs page inside the plugin admin area.</li>
<li>Fixed: Various JavaScript issues on create post/page/form pages in WordPress 5.6.</li>
<li>Fixed: Edge cases when custom fields mapping for providers was broken.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.6.4</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added: hCaptcha support, see WPForms &gt; CAPTCHA settings.</li>
<li>Added: Character/word limit validation message control inside Settings &gt; Validation page.</li>
<li>Changed: Dropdown fields using the Modern format will only show the search option if at least 8 choices are provided.</li>
<li>Changed: Updated jQuery inputmask library to v5.0.6-beta20</li>
<li>Changed: Improved Form Builder Help documentation caching.</li>
<li>Changed: Only create our Logs database table when specifically enabled in the Tools settings.</li>
<li>Changed: Updated WPForms install count and rating information.</li>
<li>Changed: Added &#8220;Copy to Clipboard&#8221; button inside Form Embed modal.</li>
<li>Fixed: PHP Warning caused by Email field changes.</li>
<li>Fixed: Editing multiline text in Paragraph field breaks new lines in submitted text.</li>
<li>Fixed: Javascript conflicts with IE11.</li>
<li>Fixed: Possible errors if web host had <code>set_time_limit()</code> disabled.</li>
<li>Fixed: Email validation issue if form is in a page multiple times.</li>
<li>Fixed: Footer links in the Summary email are now working properly.</li>
<li>Fixed: Double-click issue for &#8220;Add New Account&#8221; buttons on the Settings &gt; Integrations page.</li>
<li>Fixed: Gutenberg block ignores &#8220;Include Form Styling&#8221; setting and forces full CSS stylesheet.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.6.3.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added: Native integration with Divi.</li>
<li>Added: Email field Allowlist/Denylist restrictions, see Email field Advanced Options.</li>
<li>Added: Form builder Help &#8211; contextual help, search docs, and more.</li>
<li>Added: Logging, which can be enabled for troubleshooting from WPForms &gt; Tools &gt; Logs.</li>
<li>Changed: Nicely notify users in the Form Builder when their WordPress session has expired, and they can&#8217;t save the form anymore without a page reload.</li>
<li>Changed: Better AJAX form submit field error messages handling.</li>
<li>Fixed: Custom metabox heading styling due to WordPress core changes.</li>
<li>Fixed: Page title smart tag not working in some use cases when using AJAX form submissions.</li>
<li>Fixed: Various admin area display issues when the field label is empty.</li>
<li>Fixed: Logo Translate plugin integration issues.</li>
<li>Fixed: Elementor widget edge case issues.</li>
<li>Fixed: Form settings could be visible before the form was created.</li>
<li>Fixed: Form builder styling inconsistencies with Dropdown field styles.</li>
<li>Fixed: Input mask issues with some mobile browsers, notably Chrome.</li>
<li>Fixed: Always display the WPForms admin area in the user&#8217;s language regardless of the site language.</li>
<li>Fixed: Do not load certain JS variables twice on the front end.</li>
<li>Fixed: Form title display issue inside the form builder with smaller view ports.</li>
<li>Fixed: Elementor widget display issue on frontend when no form has been created.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.6.2.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>Changed: Added shortcode access to a form embed modal and enhanced modal navigation.</li>
<li>Changed: Improved empty states for All Forms and Builder no fields preview panel.</li>
<li>Changed: Improved Email Summaries footer text.</li>
<li>Fixed: Custom validation messages for the fields appear correctly with Ajax form submission enabled.</li>
<li>Fixed: Base style CSS introduces no additional scrollbars now.</li>
<li>Fixed: Correct cursor for image choices validation messages.</li>
<li>Fixed: Getting the license details from DB works as expected regardless of a context.</li>
<li>Fixed: Getting the list of WPForms addons for user license level works as expected regardless of a context.</li>
<li>Fixed: Number Slider field increment is checked to be more than zero.</li>
<li>Fixed: Modern Dropdown validation works as expected for AJAX forms.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.6.2.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added: Caching friendly anti-spam protection (form tokens).</li>
<li>Added: Native integration with Elementor: add to the page and create new forms right inside its builder.</li>
<li>Added: Add a preview to the WPForms Gutenberg block.</li>
<li>Changed: Greatly improve WPForms Challenge experience.</li>
<li>Changed: Improve word counting when the Limit Length field option is used with Single Line Text/Paragraph Text fields.</li>
<li>Changed: Improve Number field input restrictions with various browsers.</li>
<li>Changed: Form field validation will now fail if input mask is enabled and user input does not complete required input mask elements.</li>
<li>Changed: Icon for the Multiple Choice field is now more representative.</li>
<li>Changed: Hide Delete button for a &#8220;Default Notification&#8221; in the Form Builder.</li>
<li>Changed: Improve Lite migrations for WordPress Multisite installations.</li>
<li>Changed: Update Constant Contact logos because of their rebranding.</li>
<li>Changed: Improve descriptions of various plugin options and add more context to them.</li>
<li>Fixed: Properly map fields in various addons when the first field is added in the Form Builder.</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue when editing Checkbox field entry values when dynamic choices were enabled and multiple values were saved.</li>
<li>Fixed: Refresh the list of form fields that are required to properly render marketing addons.</li>
<li>Fixed: &#8220;Invalid Form&#8221; error for logged out users upon submitting an AJAX form on some server configurations.</li>
<li>Fixed: Multiple Choice fields had issues in the builder with image choices with empty labels.</li>
<li>Fixed: Make bulk actions at the bottom of the Forms Overview work.</li>
<li>Fixed: &#8220;Single Line Text&#8221; and &#8220;Paragraph Text&#8221; calculate empty field word count incorrectly.</li>
<li>Fixed: Do not allow Action Scheduler to generate errors during the plugin uninstallation procedure.</li>
<li>Fixed: Input mask validation produces a JS error on jQuery 3.x.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.6.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added: Display a list of scheduled actions on WPForms &gt; Tools &gt; Scheduled Actions page.</li>
<li>Added: Multiple select option for Dropdown field (off by default).</li>
<li>Added: New Modern style option for Dropdown field (off by default).</li>
<li>Added: Support Smart Tags in form descriptions.</li>
<li>Fixed: Properly handle multiple clicks on various accordion-like elements on Form Builder and Settings &gt; Integrations pages.</li>
<li>Fixed: Remove all the plugin-related information on uninstall from the DB when opted-in in plugin settings.</li>
<li>Fixed: Replace all new lines characters with spaces in notification email subjects (e.g., when an address field value is used in a subject via a smart tag).</li>
<li>Fixed: Make sure the plugin doesn&#8217;t crash when <code>iconv</code> PHP extension is not installed on a server.</li>
<li>Fixed: Properly handle fields with choices with new lines in their labels when connected to Conditional Logic.</li>
<li>Fixed: Google Invisible v2 reCAPTCHA should show Submit Button Processing Text when the form is submitted.</li>
<li>Fixed: Display the list of countries in the &#8220;Countries&#8221; preset and in the Address field in alphabetical order regardless of the current site language.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.6.0.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: The default value 0 (zero) of the Paragraph Text field does not display on the frontend.</li>
<li>Fixed: Product education URL encoding issues.</li>
<li>Fixed: Securely store WPForms anonymized cookie, so it cannot be sent along with cross-site requests (samesite).</li>
<li>Fixed: Various PHP notices that may appear during wildly complicated forms submissions.</li>
<li>Fixed: Improved escaping inside Form Builder live preview, props Fortinet Fortiguard Labs.</li>
<li>Fixed: Incorrect interval value was used when running a cleanup job after notifications sent.</li>
<li>Fixed: Delete orphaned plugin translation files when cleanup option in plugin settings is checked and the plugin is deleted from the site.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.6.0.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added: Admin bar menu item.</li>
<li>Added: Form Builder alert when using browser &#8220;Back&#8221; button if form contains unsaved changes.</li>
<li>Added: Settings &gt; Emails: &#8220;Optimize Email Sending&#8221; option which enables sending emails asynchronously.</li>
<li>Changed: Async form notification emails are now off by default.</li>
<li>Changed: Number Slider field display improvements on small devices.</li>
<li>Fixed: Error if there are some plugins or themes add <code>widget_title</code> filter.</li>
<li>Fixed: Choice Images not displaying in form notifications if no label is set.</li>
<li>Fixed: Form Builder &#8220;drag zone&#8221; not available when all fields are deleted.</li>
<li>Fixed: Empty <code>div</code> appended to end of form display.</li>
<li>Fixed: Block alignment issues (WordPress 5.4+).</li>
<li>Fixed: Form Builder field option panel is not available if field is placed before the last form field.</li>
<li>Fixed: Fallback population for fields with choices (checkbox, radio etc) when special characters are used.</li>
<li>Fixed: Integrity of decoded data with additional sanitizing.</li>
<li>Fixed: Compatibility issues with Elementor.</li>
</ul>
<p><a href="https://plugins.svn.wordpress.org/wpforms-lite/trunk/changelog.txt" rel="nofollow ugc">See changelog for all versions</a>.</p>

:61:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wpforms-lite.1.6.6.zip";s:5:"1.6.7";s:61:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wpforms-lite.1.6.7.zip";s:7:"1.6.7.1";s:63:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wpforms-lite.1.6.7.1.zip";s:7:"1.6.7.2";s:63:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wpforms-lite.1.6.7.2.zip";s:7:"1.6.7.3";s:63:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wpforms-lite.1.6.7.3.zip";s:5:"1.6.8";s:61:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wpforms-lite.1.6.8.zip";s:7:"1.6.8.1";s:63:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wpforms-lite.1.6.8.1.zip";s:5:"1.6.9";s:61:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wpforms-lite.1.6.9.zip";s:5:"1.7.0";s:61:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wpforms-lite.1.7.0.zip";s:7:"1.7.1.1";s:63:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wpforms-lite.1.7.1.1.zip";s:7:"1.7.1.2";s:63:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wpforms-lite.1.7.1.2.zip";s:5:"trunk";s:55:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wpforms-lite.zip";}s:11:"donate_link";s:0:"";s:5:"icons";a:3:{s:2:"1x";s:57:"https://ps.w.org/wpforms-lite/assets/icon.svg?rev=2574198";s:2:"2x";s:65:"https://ps.w.org/wpforms-lite/assets/icon-256x256.png?rev=2574201";s:3:"svg";s:57:"https://ps.w.org/wpforms-lite/assets/icon.svg?rev=2574198";}s:12:"contributors";a:0:{}s:6:"market";N;s:11:"custom_link";N;}s:30:"regenerate-thumbnails-advanced";a:28:{s:4:"name";s:30:"reGenerate Thumbnails Advanced";s:4:"slug";s:30:"regenerate-thumbnails-advanced";s:7:"version";s:5:"2.4.0";s:6:"author";s:48:"<a href="https://shortpixel.com/">ShortPixel</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:42:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/shortpixel/";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.0";s:6:"tested";s:5:"5.7.4";s:12:"requires_php";s:3:"5.3";s:6:"rating";i:78;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:19;i:4;i:0;i:3;i:1;i:2;i:0;i:1;i:7;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:27;s:15:"support_threads";i:4;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:4;s:10:"downloaded";i:773165;s:12:"last_updated";s:22:"2021-03-09 12:22pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2015-07-10";s:8:"homepage";s:0:"";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:2405:"<p><strong>A free, fast and easy to use regenerate thumbnails plugin supported by ShortPixel ðŸ™‚</strong></p>
<p>Regenerate Thumbnails Advanced (RTA) plugin comes in handy when you install a new WordPress theme on your site that has different image sizes. While the newly uploaded images will be cropped and resized to fit your new theme, the old thumbnails will remain unchanged. Using RTA you can regenerate the thumbnails for all your existing images.<br />
It is also very useful when you have many not-used-anymore thumbnails and you want to remove them while making sure you have all the needed thumbnails generated.</p>
<p>Features:</p>
<ul>
<li>Choose the quality of the regenerated thumbs.</li>
<li>Option to remove not-used-anymore thumbnails.</li>
<li>Remove metadata for missing images and thumbnails</li>
<li>Fully integrated with <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/shortpixel-image-optimiser/">ShortPixel Image Optimizer</a>.</li>
<li>Option to select the thumbnail size for featured and non-featured images.</li>
<li>Option to easily add as many extra thumbnail sizes as you wish.</li>
<li>Interval selection (last day, week, month, all) for the thumbs that will be regenerated.</li>
<li>Clean and simple interface where you have a progress bar showing you the percentage of images regenerated.</li>
<li>Resume function &#8211; the regeneration process will continue from where it was left in case you accidentally close the processing tab in your browser.</li>
</ul>
<p>Support:<br />
For support please contact us <a href="https://shortpixel.com/contact" rel="nofollow ugc">here</a> making sure you mention RTA plugin.</p>
<p><strong>Other plugins by ShortPixel</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Image optimization &amp; compression for all the images on your site, including WebP delivery &#8211; <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/shortpixel-image-optimiser/">ShortPixel Image Optimizer</a></li>
<li>Image optimization &amp; CDN on the fly &#8211; <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/shortpixel-adaptive-images/">ShortPixel Adaptive Images</a></li>
<li>Easily replace images or files in Media Library &#8211; <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/enable-media-replace/">Enable Media Replace</a></li>
<li>Make sure you don&#8217;t have huge images in your Media Library &#8211; <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/resize-image-after-upload/">Resize Image After Upload</a></li>
</ul>
";s:12:"installation";s:261:"<p>Nothing special about the installation process, just visit &#8220;Plugins&#8221; section in your /wp-admin, search for &#8220;regenerate thumbnails advanced&#8221;, install &amp; activate the plugin and then from Settings section you can start using it.</p>
";s:3:"faq";s:494:"
<dt id='can%20i%20regenerate%20just%20a%20few%20images'>
Can I regenerate just a few images
</h4>
<p>
<p>You have the option to select from: all, past day, past week, past month</p>
</p>
<dt id='what%20happens%20if%20i%20close%20the%20page%20while%20the%20regeneration%20process%20is%20running%3F'>
What happens if I close the page while the regeneration process is running?
</h4>
<p>
<p>The script stops but it will resume after you open the settings page of the plugin once again.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:3102:"<h4>2.4.0</h4>
<p>Release date: December 1st 2020<br />
* New: Pause Button;<br />
* New: Resuming process from another page now starts paused;<br />
* New: Added Filter for increasing number of items processed per run;<br />
* Fix: Users optimizing more than 50K images could run into a code loop protection.</p>
<h4>2.3.2</h4>
<p>Release date: August 17th 2020<br />
* Fix : Regenerate Period now calculates from time set in WordPress to respect timezone settting.</p>
<h4>2.3.1</h4>
<p>Release date: July 13th 2020<br />
* Fix: PHP warning that was displayed on PHP 7.4.x.</p>
<h4>2.3.0</h4>
<p>Release date:  29th May 2020<br />
* New system for queuing which should be more efficient;<br />
* New &#8211; Added regenerate thumbnails button in edit-attachment screen;<br />
* Fixed &#8211; Crash when regenerating image from edit media;<br />
* Fixed &#8211; Queries for large amount of images should not timeout;<br />
* Fixes for the responsiveness of the regeneration screen;<br />
* Class loader moved to PSR-4.</p>
<h4>2.2.0</h4>
<p>Release date: 9th March 2020<br />
* Reworked and improved the process interface<br />
* Option in media library to regenerate just one image<br />
* Will check for post_mime_type in posts and fix it when it&#8217;s empty.<br />
* Cookie-based processing removed, now keeps progress as a server setting<br />
* Internal processes optimized.<br />
* Fixed &#8211; WordPress 5.3 image handling and scaled images<br />
* Fixed &#8211; Metadata not being removed in some cases when &#8220;Delete Leftover Image Metadata&#8221; is checked.<br />
* Fixed &#8211; Logger doesn&#8217;t call wp_upload_dir when not debugging</p>
<h4>2.1.0</h4>
<p>Release date: 7th June 2019<br />
* Replace the two options Exact size for featured/non-featured images with one checkbox Only featured<br />
* Button to stop the regeneration<br />
* Make Keep existing be checked by default<br />
* Change &#8220;Regenerate selected thumbnails&#8221; checklist to a settings selection<br />
* ShortPixel Image Optimizer integration &#8211; call the &#8216;shortpixel-thumbnails-regenerated&#8217; action passing only the changed sizes<br />
* Fix: Security &#8211; Image sizes XSS exploit<br />
* Fix: count(): Parameter must be an array</p>
<h4>2.0.1</h4>
<p>Release date: 17th April 2019<br />
* Fix warnings related to corrupted metadata in some cases</p>
<h4>2.0.0</h4>
<p>Release date: 16th April 2019<br />
* Plugin completely rewritten with additional features added:<br />
* Add custom thumbnails<br />
* Select which thumbnails to regenerate<br />
* Regenerate thumbnails only for the featured images<br />
* Rewrite the existing thumbnails or not depending on the selected options<br />
* Integrate seamlessly with <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/shortpixel-image-optimiser/">ShortPixel Image Optimizer</a><br />
* Delete unused thumbnails from disk<br />
* Remove metadata for missing images and thumbnails</p>
<h4>EARLIER VERSIONS</h4>
<ul>
<li>please refer to the changelog.txt file inside the plugin archive for the versions before the 2.0.0 full rewrite.</li>
</ul>

href="https://tobias.baethge.com/">Tobias BÃ¤thge</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:40:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/tobiasbg/";s:8:"requires";s:3:"5.6";s:6:"tested";s:5:"5.8.2";s:12:"requires_php";s:6:"5.6.20";s:6:"rating";i:100;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:4202;i:4;i:34;i:3;i:7;i:2;i:4;i:1;i:13;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:4260;s:15:"support_threads";i:156;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:144;s:10:"downloaded";i:7713700;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2021-07-20 1:36pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2012-06-14";s:8:"homepage";s:23:"https://tablepress.org/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:3118:"<p>TablePress allows you to easily create and manage beautiful tables. You can embed the tables into posts, pages, or text widgets with a simple Shortcode. Table data can be edited in a spreadsheet-like interface, so no coding is necessary. Tables can contain any type of data, even formulas that will be evaluated. An additional JavaScript library adds features like sorting, pagination, filtering, and more for site visitors. Tables can be imported and exported from/to Excel, CSV, HTML, and JSON files.</p>
<h4>More information</h4>
<p>Please visit the plugin website at <a href="https://tablepress.org/" rel="nofollow ugc">tablepress.org</a> for more information or a <a href="https://tablepress.org/demo/" rel="nofollow ugc">demo</a>. For latest news, <a href="https://twitter.com/TablePress" rel="nofollow ugc">follow @TablePress</a> on Twitter.</p>
<h4>Supporting future development</h4>
<p>If you like TablePress, please rate and review it here in the WordPress Plugin Directory or support it with your <a href="https://tablepress.org/donate/" rel="nofollow ugc">donation</a>. Thank you!</p>
<h4>TablePress Extensions</h4>
<p>Additional features and useful enhancements are available as separate plugins, called <a href="https://tablepress.org/extensions/" rel="nofollow ugc">TablePress Extensions</a>, on the plugin website.</p>
<p>Do you have a lot of tables? You can organize them in folders! <a href="https://tablepress.org/extensions/wicked-folders-pro/" rel="nofollow ugc">Wicked Folders Pro supports TablePress</a> and might be the right solution for you.</p>
<h3>Usage</h3>
<p>After installing the plugin, you can create and manage tables on the &#8220;TablePress&#8221; screen in the WordPress Dashboard.</p>
<p>To show one of your tables in a post or on a page, embed the Shortcode <code>[table id=&lt;the-ID&gt; /]</code> into a &#8220;Shortcode&#8221; block at the desired place in the block editor. Each table has a unique ID that needs to be adjusted in that Shortcode.</p>
<p>After that, you might want to change the styling of the table. You can do this by entering CSS commands into the &#8220;Custom CSS&#8221; textarea on the &#8220;Plugin Options&#8221; screen. Some examples for common styling changes can be found on the <a href="https://tablepress.org/faq/" rel="nofollow ugc">TablePress FAQ page</a>.<br />
You may also add certain features (like sorting, pagination, filtering, alternating row colors, row highlighting, print name and/or description, &#8230;) by enabling the corresponding checkboxes on a table&#8217;s &#8220;Edit&#8221; screen.</p>
<h3>Acknowledgements</h3>
<p>Special thanks go to <a href="https://www.sprymedia.co.uk/" rel="nofollow ugc">Allan Jardine</a> for the <a href="https://www.datatables.net/" rel="nofollow ugc">DataTables JavaScript library</a>.<br />
Thanks to all language file translators!<br />
Thanks to every donor, supporter, and bug reporter!</p>
<h3>License</h3>
<p>This plugin is Free Software, released and licensed under the GPL, version 2 (https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-2.0.html).<br />
You may use it free of charge for any purpose.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:1375:"<p>The easiest way to install TablePress is via your WordPress Dashboard. Go to the &#8220;Plugins&#8221; screen, click &#8220;Add New&#8221;, and search for &#8220;TablePress&#8221; in the WordPress Plugin Directory. Then, click &#8220;Install Now&#8221; and wait a moment. Finally, click &#8220;Activate&#8221; and start using the plugin!</p>
<p>Manual installation works just as for other WordPress plugins:</p>
<ol>
<li><a href="https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/tablepress.latest-stable.zip" rel="nofollow ugc">Download</a> and extract the ZIP file.</li>
<li>Move the folder &#8220;tablepress&#8221; to the &#8220;wp-content/plugins/&#8221; directory of your WordPress installation, e.g. via FTP.</li>
<li>Activate the plugin &#8220;TablePress&#8221; on the &#8220;Plugins&#8221; screen of your WordPress Dashboard.</li>
<li>Create and manage tables by going to the &#8220;TablePress&#8221; screen in the admin menu.</li>
<li>To insert a table into a post or page, copy its Shortcode <code>[table id=&lt;ID&gt; /]</code> and paste it into a &#8220;Shortcode&#8221; block at the desired place in the block editor. Each table has a unique ID that needs to be adjusted in that Shortcode.</li>
<li>You can change the table styling by using CSS code, which can be entered into the &#8220;Custom CSS&#8221; textarea on the &#8220;Plugin Options&#8221; screen.</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:2491:"
<dt id='where%20can%20i%20find%20answers%20to%20frequently%20asked%20questions%3F'>
Where can I find answers to Frequently Asked Questions?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Many questions, regarding different features or styling, have been answered on the <a href="https://tablepress.org/faq/" rel="nofollow ugc">FAQ page</a> on the plugin website.</p>
</p>
<dt id='support%3F'>
Support?
</h4>
<p>
<p>For support questions, bug reports, or feature requests, please use the <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/tablepress/">WordPress Support Forums</a>. Please search through the forums first, and only <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/tablepress#new-post">create a new topic</a> if you don&#8217;t find an existing answer. Thank you!</p>
</p>
<dt id='requirements%3F'>
Requirements?
</h4>
<p>
<p>In short: WordPress 5.6 or higher, while the latest version of WordPress is always recommended.</p>
</p>
<dt id='languages%20and%20localization%3F'>
Languages and Localization?
</h4>
<p>
<p>TablePress uses the <a href="https://translate.wordpress.org/" rel="nofollow ugc">&#8220;Translate WordPress&#8221; platform</a>. Please see the sidebar on the TablePress page in the <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/tablepress/">WordPress Plugin Directory</a> for available translations.</p>
<p>To make TablePress available in your language, go to the <a href="https://translate.wordpress.org/projects/wp-plugins/tablepress" rel="nofollow ugc">TablePress translations page</a>, log in with a free wordpress.org account and start translating.</p>
</p>
<dt id='migration%20from%20wp-table%20reloaded'>
Migration from WP-Table Reloaded
</h4>
<p>
<p>Several years ago, TablePress has superseded the now discontinued WP-Table Reloaded plugin. If you are still using that, please see the <a href="https://tablepress.org/migration-from-wp-table-reloaded/" rel="nofollow ugc">migration guide</a> and switch to TablePress.</p>
</p>
<dt id='development'>
Development
</h4>
<p>
<p>You can follow the development of TablePress more closely in its official <a href="https://github.com/TobiasBg/TablePress" rel="nofollow ugc">GitHub repository</a>.</p>
</p>
<dt id='where%20can%20i%20get%20more%20information%3F'>
Where can I get more information?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Please visit the <a href="https://tablepress.org/" rel="nofollow ugc">official plugin website</a> for the latest information on this plugin, or <a href="https://twitter.com/TablePress" rel="nofollow ugc">follow @TablePress</a> on Twitter.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:2069:"<p>Recent changes are shown below. For earlier changes, please see the <a href="https://tablepress.org/info/#changelog" rel="nofollow ugc">changelog history</a>.</p>
<h4>Version 1.14</h4>
<ul>
<li>Full compatibility with WordPress 5.8.</li>
<li>Enhancement: Make behavior of bulk action selectors on the &#8220;All tables&#8221; screen more user-friendly.</li>
<li>Enhancement: Apply and enforce more granular coding standards for better code maintainability.</li>
<li>Enhancement: Allow import files with an .xlsm file extension, in addition to .xlsx files.</li>
<li>Enhancement: Add more options (filter and action hooks) for external integration of custom code.</li>
<li>Bugfix: Fix handling of the help box on the &#8220;Edit&#8221; screen when it&#8217;s opened again after closing it.</li>
<li>Bugfix: Properly return modified table data when external code integrates into TablePress.</li>
<li>Bugfix: Correctly localize dates in files names of downloaded export files.</li>
<li>Bugfix: Fix typos in the code for math formula parsing that could lead to error messages in rare cases.</li>
<li>Updated external libraries (DataTables, SimpleXLSX, Build tools).</li>
<li>Some internal changes for better stability, translations, and documentation.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Version 1.13</h4>
<ul>
<li>Full compatibility with WordPress 5.7.</li>
<li>Enhancement: Allow replacing/appending existing tables when importing a ZIP archive of files.</li>
<li>Enhancement: Add ARIA labels to the table when its name or description is printed.</li>
<li>Enhancement: Update list of allowed CSS features in &#8220;Custom CSS&#8221;.</li>
<li>Enhancement: Increase compatibility with PHP 8 and jQuery 3.x by no longer using deprecated functions.</li>
<li>Bugfix: Properly update cell references in formulas when one is moved, on the &#8220;Edit&#8221; screen.</li>
<li>Updated external libraries (DataTables, SimpleXLSX, CSSTidy, Build tools).</li>
<li>Some internal changes for better stability, translations, and documentation.</li>
<li>TablePress 1.13 requires WordPress 5.6!</li>
</ul>
";s:11:"screenshots";s:1961:"<ol><li><a href="https://ps.w.org/tablepress/assets/screenshot-1.png?rev=2193187"><img src="https://ps.w.org/tablepress/assets/screenshot-1.png?rev=2193187" alt="&quot;All Whether your events are in-person or virtual events, this WordPress calendar plugin boasts professional features backed by our world-class team of developers and designers.</p>

</p>
<p>Packed with loads of features, The Events Calendar is ready to go out of the box. Itâ€™s also extensible, easy to use, and completely customizable.</p>
<p>From now through December 31st ðŸš¨ save 30% ðŸš¨ on all new plugin purchases and 15% off the already-discounted bundle prices. You canâ€™t beat that! <a href="https://evnt.is/1b1b" rel="nofollow ugc">Check out our End of Year Sale</a>.</p>
<h4>ðŸ“… The #1 Calendar for WordPress</h4>
<p>See the calendar in action on our <a href="https://evnt.is/1ajs" rel="nofollow ugc">demo experience</a>. Just getting started? Read through the <a href="https://evnt.is/2d" rel="nofollow ugc">New User Primer</a> to get set up.</p>

<h4>ðŸ”ŒðŸŽ¨ Plug and Play or Customize</h4>
<p>The Events Calendar is built to work out of the box. Simply install the plugin, configure your settings, and start creating events in minutes.</p>
<p>Want to add your personal touch? Use The Events Calendar as the foundation for customization. Personalize to your heart&#8217;s content with the help of a skeleton stylesheet, partial template overrides, template tags, hooks and filters, <a href="https://evnt.is/eu" rel="nofollow ugc">careful documentation</a>, and a <a href="https://evnt.is/1a0r" rel="nofollow ugc">library of free extensions</a>.</p>
<p>Whether your vision is big or small, you&#8217;re in good company. Hundreds of thousands of small businesses, musicians, venues, restaurants, and non-profits are publishing and promoting their in-person and virtual events with The Events Calendar. Our plugins have also been scaled to work on large networks for Fortune 100 companies, universities, and government institutions.</p>

<h3>Help</h3>
